screenshot.caption: PSD file open in Adobe Photoshop 2025

description: The PSD format is a fully editable, uncompressed format, ideal for editing raster images. You can modify individual elements within a PSD file, such as images, shapes, text, and effects. New versions of Photoshop (2024 and later) allow you to create and insert AI-generated graphics.
PSD files support RGB , CMYK , grayscale, monochrome, duotone, indexed color, Lab color, and multichannel color modes. You can change the color mode by selecting the Image â†’ Mode in Photoshop.
The Photoshop file format is comprised of five sections:
NOTE: Photoshop supports PSD files up to 30,000 x 30,000 pixels or 2 GB in size. Images larger than these limits must be saved in the .PSB (Photoshop Big) Large Document format.
